item.title: Israeli Defense Firm Elbit Sees More Business in Europe
item.description: The head of one of Israel’s biggest defense firms said European sales will keep growing, shrugging off calls for sanctions and trade restrictions over the war in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Galit Altstein

media:content.media:description: An Israeli Air Force Hermes 900 unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) in a hangar at Palmachim Airbase in Palmachim, Israel, on Wednesday, Nov. 22, 2023. The main thrust of Israel’s ground offensive is into Gaza City, the strip’s biggest urban area and which the military describes as Hamas’s “center of gravity.”

item.title: Saudi Arabia’s Mega Neom Hydrogen Project Faces Demand Risk
item.description: The world’s largest green hydrogen project being built in Saudi Arabia’s Neom is facing an uncertain future as it struggles to find international buyers for the fuel.
item.dc:creator: Verity Ratcliffe, Matthew Martin

item.title: Platinum Eases From One-Year High as Market Weighs Shortage
item.description: Platinum eased after rallying to a one-year high, as traders weighed ongoing deficits against an uncertain demand outlook.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan

item.title: Stocks, Bonds Steady as Tax Bill Wrangling Unfolds: Markets Wrap
item.description: US bonds and stocks steadied after a volatile day with investors focusing on how talks over President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill play out. Private-sector data will also offer insight on how the economy is faring.
item.dc:creator: Andre Janse Van Vuuren, Julien Ponthus

item.title: UK Blocked from Signing Chagos Islands Deal by High Court
item.description: The UK government was temporarily blocked from transferring the ownership of the Chagos Islands after a High Court judge issued an injunction in the early hours of Thursday morning.
item.dc:creator: Lucca De Paoli, Upmanyu Trivedi

media:content.media:description: Chagos Islands is an overseas territory of the United Kingdom situated in the Indian Ocean, halfway between Africa and Indonesia. Photographer: Pictures From History/Universal Images Group/Getty Images

item.title: Bitcoin Rally Takes Largest Token Past $111,000 for First Time
item.description: Bitcoin surpassed $111,000 for the first time, with traders increasingly bullish on the prospects of the original cryptocurrency amid mounting institutional demand and support from Donald Trump’s administration.
item.dc:creator: Suvashree Ghosh, Sidhartha Shukla

media:content.media:description: A Bitcoin logo inside a cryptocurrency exchange in Barcelona, Spain, on Wednesday, March 9, 2022. Bitcoin dropped back below $40,000, erasing almost all the gains sparked by optimism about U.S. President Joe Biden’s executive order to put more focus on the crypto sector.

item.title: TD Beats Estimates on Lower-Than-Expected Loan Loss Provisions
item.description: Toronto-Dominion Bank beat estimates after setting aside less money than expected for souring loans, despite concerns that US tariffs will hamper economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Christine Dobby

media:content.media:description: The Toronto-Dominion (TD) bank headquarters in the financial district of Toronto, Ontario, Canada, on Thursday, April 24, 2025. As President Donald Trump's trade war continues, Canadian equities are poised to outperform their US counterparts, portfolio managers argue.

item.title: RBA Ready to Respond If Needed to Trade Shock, Hauser Says
item.description: Australia’s central bank is ready to respond with policy in the event of deepening global fallout from the Trump administration’s tariff regime, Deputy Governor Andrew Hauser said, adding that there are few signs of any local impact at this stage.
item.dc:creator: Swati Pandey

media:content.media:description: Andrew Hause speaks at the Lowy Institute in Sydney on May 22.

item.title: Bundesbank Backs Delay to Trading Rules for European Lenders
item.description: Germany’s Bundesbank said Europe should delay new global capital requirements for banks’ trading businesses and could eventually consider permanent changes to them.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Comfort

item.title: Country Garden Debt Plan Gets Nearly 75% of Bondholders’ Support
item.description: Chinese developer Country Garden Holdings Co. has secured backing from nearly 75% of bondholders for its offshore restructuring, according to people familiar with the matter, ahead of a liquidation hearing next week.
item.dc:creator: Trista Xinyi Luo, Pearl Liu, Jackie Cai

media:content.media:description: Residential buildings under construction at Country Garden Holdings Co.'s Century Center development in Foshan. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: German Business Expectations Improve as Trade Fears Ease
item.description: German companies’ economic outlook improved as concern over President Donald Trump’s trade policy eased and an imminent boost to public spending buoyed sentiment.

item.title: German Wage Growth Slows Sharply as Economy Struggles to Grow
item.description: German wage growth has eased significantly, and economic weakness suggests future deals will likely be much lower than in the past, according to the Bundesbank.
item.dc:creator: Jana Randow

item.title: Data Center Leaders on Building AI’s Infrastructure

Ganzi, CEO, DigitalBridge; and Goodwin Gaw, Chairman, Managing Principal, Member of Investment Committee & Co-Founder, Gaw Capital discuss how next-generation data centers are evolving to meet the demands of artificial intelligence, and the critical role infrastructure and capital play in building AI’s backbone with Bloomberg’s Joumanna Bercetche at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. item.title: BYD Beats Tesla in Europe for First Time With 169% Sales Surge
item.description: BYD Co. sold more electric vehicles in Europe than Tesla Inc. for the first time, overtaking the American brand that’s long led the continent’s EV segment.
item.dc:creator: William Wilkes

media:content.media:description: BYD Co. Dolphin Surf electric vehicle at the model launch event in Paris on May 21.

item.title: Ninety One CEO Weighs in on Trump-Ramaphosa Meeting
item.description: Ninety One CEO, Hendrik du Toit says President Donald Trump’s meeting with his South African counterpart, Cyril Ramaphosa is “a very good lesson” for the leadership of the country, which he highlighted should find a way to "cooperate with large economic blocs" around the world, including the "US, China or Europe." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rio Starts Next CEO Hunt as Stausholm To Leave This Year
item.description: Rio Tinto Group has started the hunt for a new chief executive officer after announcing that Jakob Stausholm will step down later this year.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Gemmell, Thomas Biesheuvel

media:content.media:description: Safety hats outside a break room overlooking the Rio Tinto Group's Gudai-Darri iron ore mine in the Pilbara region of Western Australia, on Thursday, Oct. 19, 2023. Rio Tinto Group, BHP Group Ltd. and Fortescue Metals Group Ltd. produce almost two-thirds of the world’s seaborne iron ore from Western Australia, and margins remain enviable. For the first time in a generation, though, the specter of disruption looms over mining’s most reliable profit generator.

item.title: Oil Extends Decline as OPEC+ Considers Another Output Surge
item.description: Oil declined for a third day as OPEC+ members discussed another super-sized production increase for July, just as demand faces headwinds from the US-led trade war.
item.dc:creator: Grant Smith, Yongchang Chin

media:content.media:description: The Deer Park Complex oil refinery and petrochemical plant, owned by Petroleos Mexicanos (PEMEX), in Houston, Texas, US, on Saturday, March 8, 2025. Some 40% of the crude oil processed at US refineries is imported, and Canada and Mexico, the No. 1 and No. 2 foreign suppliers of oil to the US, respectively, together deliver more than two-thirds of that oil. Photographer: Mark Felix/Bloomberg

item.title: Tycoon Birla’s Firm Gets Cheapest Rupee Bond Deal in Five Years
item.description: Grasim Industries Ltd. has secured its lowest-cost local-currency bond since June 2020, a sign that interest rate cuts and recent cash infusions by the Indian central bank are benefiting companies.
item.dc:creator: Divya Patil, Sanjai P R

media:content.media:description: Birla Opus paint canisters at the Grasim Industries Ltd. paint factory in Panipat, Haryana, India, on Thursday, Feb. 22, 2024. Grasim Industries is looking to generate revenue of $1.2 billion in three years from its fledgling paints business as the flagship of billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla’s conglomerate takes on entrenched rivals such as Asian Paints Ltd. and Berger Paints India Ltd.

item.title: Southern Greek Islands Hit by 6.1-Magnitude Earthquake
item.description: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — An undersea 6.1-magnitude earthquake scale struck off the Greek island of Crete early Thursday and was felt across the Aegean Sea, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or significant damage.

item.title: Manchester United Shares Slide After Europa League Final Defeat
